snippet: The New York City Housing Authority will begin a pilot program next month that aims to help recently released prisoners reunite with their families.
abstract: New York City Housing Authority announces easing of ban on recently released prisoners, allowing some of them to live in public housing; will begin pilot program that aims to relax admission policies to help recently released prisoners reunite with their families; move makes authority one of first public housing agencies in nation to test lifting such restrictions.
lead_paragraph: The New York City Housing Authority will begin a pilot program next month that aims to help recently released prisoners reunite with their families.

headline.main: Ban on Former Inmates in Public Housing Is Eased
headline.print_headline: Ban on Former Inmates In Public Housing Is Eased
